May 25th4
Dr Elza D. Maxey.
Centre Point. Ky.
Sir.

His Excellency -- Gov. Bramlette has referred your letter of the 20th inst. to this office. All persons whom the Laws of the United States exempt from military duty -- are exempt under the Laws of Kentucky from duty in the Militia force. Others, in State employ, or otherwise -- are exempt, as you will see by referring to the Militia Law of Kentucky -- Sec. 27. As to those who claim exemption on the plea of physical disability, and have not been declared exempt by any United States officer, it is presumed your knowledge as a surgeon will enable you to give proper certificates in their cases. You may be able to obtain a copy of the orders of the Pro. Mar. General -- defining cause for exemption -- from the Pro. Marshal of your District.

Respectfully
Your obt serv't.
John Boyle
Adjt Gen Ky
